content: stitch k next stitch cont in pattern till 2 sts left kfb k last stitch ws p2 cont in pattern till 2 sts left p2 *note kfb increases can only be worked every 2 6 10 14 row etc in order to maintain moss stitch pattern they must be worked on rs row when the first and second stitch are both k stitches if you change sleeve panel measurements maintain increases to this pattern cont in pattern for a total of 107 row 121 row including 14 rib row bind off on rs row row 108 on chart c leave a long enough tail to sew up the sleeve to body panel/shoulder at the end ~40 in/ 100 cm posted for free only on ravelry ©copyright gia giaetcetra 2025 5 *chart c row after 108 are only relevant if you are making the sleeve panel longer sample photo sleeves are bound off on row 108 sewing panels block all panels before seaming up using mattress stitch sew up panels using long tail ends that were left when casting on or binding off start with top of the front and back panels which will seam up to be the top of the shoulders 41 stitches are sewn together next i sewed the sleeves to the body panels because these stitches are not going in the same direction they will not line up perfectly row per stitch approximately every 10 row on the body panel lined up to every 7-8 stitches on the sleeve panel so every couple of row 2 stitch bars on the body panel are stitched to 1 v stitch on the sleeve i suggest placing stitch markers as bench markers before you begin seaming to ensure the middle stitch of the sleeve panel is at the center of the shoulder where the top of front and back body panels are already seamed up next i sewed the body and sleeves together starting at the bottom of the body panel where long tail end was left use mattress stitch to seam up front and back panel continue through the under arm and down along the sleeve using the same long tail end from the body cast on edge ending at the sleeve cuff do this for both sides make sure mattress stitching is not too tight stretch it a bit before weaving in/knotting any ends collar starting at the back right shoulder seam pick up 98 stitches using a us 7 4 5mm i picked up every stitch along the neckline working out to be 40 sts across back 15 sts across left as worn neckline slope 28 sts across front 15 sts across right as worn neckline slope work in 1x1 ribbing for 7 rounds k1 p1 on round 8 work stockinette k all while decreasing 8 sts evenly throughout using k2tog k2tog approx every 12 sts work 3 more rounds stockinette stitch k all 4 rounds k all in total bind off weave in all ends enjoy
